messages.text: Good morning, everyone! How was the long weekend?
Morning! It was awesome. I finally went hiking up Eagle Creek Trail. The waterfalls were breathtaking!
Nice! I’ve been meaning to check that out. Did you go all the way to Tunnel Falls?
Yup! It’s about a 12-mile round trip, so my legs are sore, but it was worth it. The mist from the falls was so refreshing after the hike up. What about you, [User 3]?
I stayed in town but had a blast. My partner and I went to that new ramen spot downtown—Tonkotsu Heaven. The broth was ridiculously good, and they make the noodles in-house!
I’ve heard of that place! Did you have to wait long? I imagine it was packed over the weekend.
We got there right when they opened, so we only waited about 15 minutes. By the time we left, the line was out the door!
Smart move! My weekend was pretty chill. I finally started that woodworking project I’ve been putting off—building a coffee table. It’s coming together nicely, but my garage is a sawdust storm now.
A coffee table? That’s ambitious! What kind of wood are you using?
I’m using reclaimed oak. It’s got a lot of character—knots, a few imperfections. I’m leaning into that rustic vibe.
That sounds amazing. You’ll have to show us pictures when it’s done!
Definitely! I’ll probably finish it next weekend. So, [User 2], was the trail crowded, or did you have some quiet moments?

It was pretty busy at the start, but as we got further in, it thinned out. By the time we hit Tunnel Falls, there were only a couple of other groups. The sound of the water and the greenery made it so peaceful.
That sounds perfect. I’ve got to make time for that hike soon. Did you take any pictures?
Tons! I’ll share them in the group chat later. The light coming through the trees made for some epic shots.
Looking forward to seeing those! Sounds like everyone had a great weekend. We should plan a group hike or outing soon.
I’m in! Maybe we can do Eagle Creek together. Or even try camping—make a full weekend out of it.
Camping sounds great! Let’s start planning soon. Maybe springtime?
Spring works for me. Let’s make it happen!
hi peter!
this is me!
hi alice!
i am alice!
great to meet you
what are some of your favorite foods?
i like strawbery
that is my favorite as well!
dogs rule
i also like to have fun
cats rule
hi charlie!
hi alice!
